item.title: The Princess and the Frog
item.description: Once upon a time, in a grand and beautiful kingdom, there lived a kind and gentle princess named Nisha. She had everything a princess could wish for luxurious dresses, a beautiful palace, and all the comforts of royal life. But despite all this, Princess Nisha was lonely and longed for a true friend. One fine day, while walking through the lush palace gardens, Princess Nisha came upon a beautiful
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Frog and the Scorpion
item.description: Once upon a time, in a lush and verdant forest, there lived a wise old frog named Manas. Manas was known throughout the forest for his keen intellect and his ability to see the best in everyone, even those with a less-than-stellar reputation. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Red Shoes
item.description: Once upon a time, in a quaint village nestled at the foot of a towering mountain, there lived a young girl named Lakshmi. Lakshmi was a sweet and innocent child with a passion for dancing and she dreamed of one day becoming a great ballerina. One day, while exploring the village marketplace, Lakshmi came across a beautiful pair of red shoes displayed in the window of a small shoemaker's shop.
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Wise Parrot
item.description: Once upon a time, in a lush forest teeming with life, there lived a wise and colorful parrot named Pavo. Pavo was unlike any other parrot in the forest; he possessed a keen intellect and a gift for wisdom that set him apart from his feathered companions. Every day, creatures from all corners of the forest would flock to Pavo's perch, seeking his advice and guidance on matters both great and s
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Boy and the Magic Lamp
item.description: Once upon a time, in a small village on the edge of a vast desert, there lived a young boy named Ali. Ali was an orphan who lived with his elderly grandmother in a humble mud-brick house. Despite their poverty, Ali and his grandmother shared a close bond and worked hard to make ends meet. Ali would spend his days exploring the desert, searching for scraps of wood and metal to sell in the village
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Talking Tree
item.description: Once upon a time, in a mystical forest shrouded in mystery, there stood a magnificent tree known as the Whispering Willow. This ancient tree was said to possess the ability to speak, its branches swaying gently in the breeze as it shared its wisdom with all who sought its counsel. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Farmer's Lazy Sons
item.description: Once upon a time, in a peaceful village nestled among rolling hills, there lived a hardworking farmer named Janardhana. Janardhana had two sons, Deva and Madhava, who were known throughout the village for their laziness and lack of ambition. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Little Mermaid
item.description: Once upon a time, in the depths of the ocean, there lived a beautiful young mermaid named Marina. Marina was the youngest daughter of King Triton, ruler of the sea, and she was known throughout the underwater kingdom for her stunning voice and her adventurous spirit. Despite the wonders of her underwater world, Marina often found herself gazing wistfully at the surface of the ocean, longing to ex
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Clever Rabbit
item.description: Once upon a time, in a lush green forest, there lived a clever rabbit named Rupa. Rupa was known far and wide for his quick wit and cunning, which he used to outsmart predators and protect himself and his fellow forest dwellers. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Talking Cave
item.description: Once upon a time, in a lush and verdant forest, there stood a cave unlike any other. This cave was not only known for its impressive size and mysterious depths but also for its unique ability to speak. Legend has it that the cave possessed ancient wisdom and knowledge, and those who dared to enter its depths were said to emerge with newfound insight and understanding. Many adventurers and seekers
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Sun and the Moon
item.description: Once upon a time, in the vast expanse of the sky, there existed two celestial beings: the Sun and the Moon. The Sun was radiant and powerful, filling the world with warmth and light during the day, while the Moon was gentle and serene, casting a soft glow upon the earth at night. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Magic Carpet

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Blue Jackal

item.title: The Wise Old Elephant

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Mouse and the Bull
item.description: Once upon a time, in a vast and sprawling meadow, there lived a tiny mouse named Milo and a powerful bull named Boris. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Two Frogs

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Oak Tree and the Reeds

The oak tree was strong and proud, its branches reaching high into the sky, casting a wide shade over the meadow. Nearby, a group of slender reeds grew along the edge of a babbling brook. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Tiger, the Brahmin, and the Jackal
item.description: In a lush forest filled with tall trees and winding rivers, there lived a wise Brahmin. One day, as the Brahmin wandered through the forest, he stumbled upon a ferocious tiger trapped in a deep pit. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Happy Prince
item.description: Once upon a time, in a city adorned with statues and gardens, there stood a magnificent statue of a prince. The statue was covered in gold leaf, with eyes made of sapphires and a ruby embedded in its hilt. It was known as the Happy Prince. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Wolf and the Crane
item.description: Once upon a time, in the heart of a dense forest, there lived a fierce and cunning wolf named Winston. Winston was known throughout the forest for his strength and cunning, but he was also notorious for his greedy and selfish ways. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Grateful Prince

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Ant and the Grasshopper
item.description: Once upon a time, in a bustling meadow, there lived an industrious ant named Andy and a carefree grasshopper named Greg. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fox and the Leopard
item.description: In a dense forest, there lived a clever fox named Felix and a graceful leopard named Leona. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Caged Bird and the Free Bird
item.description: In a lush and vibrant forest, there were two birds: one lived in a golden cage, and the other soared freely through the open skies. The caged bird had vibrant plumage, and its melodic songs filled the air. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Boy and the Apple Tree
item.description: In a quaint village nestled between rolling hills, there was a wise old apple tree that stood in the center of a small orchard. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Elephant’s Child
item.description: Once upon a time, in the High and Far-Off Times, there was a curious elephant's child who had a very small nose. The other elephants in the jungle had long trunks, but the elephant's child was curious about everything and wanted to know what the crocodile had for dinner. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Little Engine That Could
item.description: In a small town nestled between rolling hills, there was a little blue engine. It wasn't the biggest or the strongest, but it had a heart full of determination. One day, a big train carrying toys and goodies for children broke down on its way over the mountain. The toys and goodies were stranded, and the town was sad because the children were eagerly waiting for their treats. The big engines
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fox and the Hedgehog

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Princess and the Seven Swans
item.description: Once upon a time, in a faraway kingdom, there was a wise and kind king who had seven sons and a beautiful daughter named Eliza. The queen, unfortunately, had passed away, and the king remarried. However, the new queen was an evil sorceress who despised the king's children, especially Eliza. One day, the wicked queen cast a spell on Eliza's seven brothers, turning them into swans. The curs
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fox and the Rabbit
item.description: In a peaceful meadow bordered by a dense forest, there lived a wise and cunning fox named Felix and a timid but clever rabbit named Rosie. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Patty, the milkmaid
item.description: In a small village, there lived a young milkmaid named Patty. Every day, Patty would milk the cows and carry the pail of fresh milk to the market to sell. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K
